title: Israel expands bombardment in Lebanon as UN refugee agency chief decries 'terrible crisis'
summary: Powerful new explosions rocked Beirut's southern suburbs late Saturday as Israel expanded its bombardment in Lebanon. Thousands of people in the country, including Palestinian refugees, continued to flee the widening conflict in the region.

title: Lebanon: Macron says 88 Francophone countries call for 'immediate' ceasefire
summary: At the end of a 'Francophonie' summit on Saturday, the French president told reporters that France would hold an international conference in support of Lebanon in October.

title: 'I want to go home': Ukrainians flee Russia's advance in Donbas
summary: Thousands of people evacuated the city of Pokrovsk and the surrounding area after it was hit by intense fighting. Relocated to temporary shelters in the Dnipro region, these displaced people have had to rebuild everything.

title: Morgan Vanlerberghe, the amateur detective who wants to catch the 'butcher of Mons'
summary: In 2022, Morgan Vanlerberghe published the results of his many years of research into the serial killer who murdered five women in the Belgian Ardennes. Based on this criminology enthusiast's findings, the lawyer for the family of one victim is about to request additional DNA analyses. The results could shed light on the case.

title: In Haiti, culture held hostage by gangs: 'The space for creation is shrinking by the day'
summary: The wave of violence that shook the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince and the surrounding area at the start of the year forced many cultural centers to close or reduce their activities. On the ground, novelists, filmmakers and cultural players are rallying to keep creativity alive in all its forms.

title: Côte d'Ivoire was crowned African champion of gender equality, stirring controversy
summary: According to the OECD, Côte d'Ivoire is the leading African country in the fight against discrimination against women. However, local feminist NGOs claim that this ranking reflects progress in legal frameworks rather than social norms.

title: Iran is an 'ongoing threat to the Jewish State', says Israeli president
summary: 'In many senses, we are still living the aftermath of October 7,' Isaac Herzog said on Saturday, in a statement to mark the first anniversary of the Hamas onslaught.

title: Macron urges halt to arms deliveries to Israel for use in Gaza
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron told French radio that his priority was to 'return to a political solution,' before adding France was not sending arms to Israel.

title: Four migrants, including 2-year-old, die trying to cross the Channel
summary: French officials said the accident was not a shipwreck and the dead child had been found in the boat, not in the water.

title: Filmmaker Frederick Wiseman at the heart of an exceptional French-American retrospective
summary: For the first time, the Centre Pompidou in Paris is offering the complete set of the director's 46 documentaries, and three of his early films are being re-released in theaters.

title: Emirates bans pagers, walkie-talkies onboard after Lebanon blasts
summary: The Middle East's biggest airline also announced its Iraq and Iran routes would remain suspended until Tuesday.

title: UN report says Russian prisoners of war were subjected to ill-treatment
summary: These acts of torture, perpetrated by Ukrainians, did, however, stop when the captives were transferred to official prisons, according to the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights.

title: The fish with legs that do more than just walk
summary: Walking, scratching, prey detection: The role and origin of the sea robin's legs, or gurnard, have been revealed by two American teams.

title: What resources does Hezbollah have to counter the Israeli offensive in Lebanon?
summary: Considered the world's leading non-state military power, the pro-Iranian Shiite militia can draw on a vast weapon arsenal and a large, well-trained and well-organized army in view of a new confrontation with Israel.

title: In Kyiv, a museum dedicated to the war with Russia
summary: One month after the start of the Ukrainian offensive in the Russian region of Kursk, an exhibition is already tracing its progress in Kyiv. Since 2022, the city's largest museum has collected thousands of items from both Ukraine and Russia to document the conflict.

title: Israeli bombings in Lebanon have killed entire families: 'I've lost my wife, my son, my home. My life is shattered'
summary: Mohamed Sabra, a 40-year-old businessman, was at home with his family in Nabi Ayla, in Beqaa, east of Beirut, on September 23, when the Israeli army bombed his building. Today, all he has left is his eldest son, aged 7, who was seriously wounded.

title: Covid-19: Two studies confirm the persistence of prolonged cognitive impairment up to one year after infection
summary: Researchers have demonstrated very mild cognitive impairment in young healthy patients one year after suffering from Covid without any complications. A second study shows that the brains of older patients with a severe form of the disease appear to have aged by 20 years.

title: 'For most Gazans, their days consist of queuing for water'
summary: One year after the war in Gaza started, 96% of the population still depends on international food aid, observes Antoine Renard, country director for the World Food Program in Palestine, in an interview with Le Monde.

title: 'Does the case of Sean Combs, aka Diddy, herald a #MeToo in music?'
summary: With several accusations of rape and sexual violence against him, the American rapper could become the Harvey Weinstein of the music industry. But for 30 years, Combs has benefited from an incredible level of leniency.

title: Pakistan capital at standstill as Khan supporters protest
summary: Islamabad was locked down on Saturday, swarmed by security forces, as supporters of the jailed ex-prime minister attempted to seize the streets in protest. Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi told local media that more than 550 people were arrested.

title: In Kenya, President William Ruto urges young people to emigrate
summary: Nairobi is negotiating agreements with countries with aging populations, such as Germany and Canada, to send workers there. Experts believe it's both a way to keep a hostile youth away and to bring money into Kenya.

title: 'Never quit': in Pennsylvania, Trump rallies at site of failed assassination
summary: The republican candidate returned on Saturday to the fairgrounds where he was nearly assassinated in July. He urged a large crowd to deliver an Election Day victory that he tied to his survival of the shooting.

title: In India, death of young accountant has sparked national debate on 'toxic work culture'
summary: A 26-year-old woman who worked for the auditing giant EY died suddenly in July. The cause, according to her mother, was stress and long days at work. More broadly, this extreme commitment to work, now called into question, has been reinforced by the fact that the country has become the back office of the world, analyzes Philippe Escande, an economic columnist for 'Le Monde'.

title: Intense Israeli bombing rocks Beirut as Lebanon PM urges 'pressure on Israel' for ceasefire
summary: The strikes on the Lebanese capital overnight have been described as the worst so far since Israel started bombarding Beirut. Lebanon's prime minister urged 'pressure on Israel' for a ceasefire.

title: Tunisia polls open as Kais Saied set for re-election
summary: Almost 10 million Tunisians will head to the polls on Sunday for a vote in which experts say incumbent President Kais Saied is poised for victory.

title: With the handover of the Chagos Islands, the UK cedes part of its colonial past in the Indian Ocean
summary: The Republic of Mauritius had been claiming sovereignty over these islands for over 50 years. The agreement signed by Keir Starmer's government allows the UK to keep the military base it leases to the US army.

title: October 7: A terrible day, a tragic year
summary: The atrocities committed by Hamas on October 7, 2023, plunged the Israeli-Palestinian conflict into a new, more radical phase. Israel's response soon went beyond self-defense to unrestrained vengeance, destroying Gaza and its population. This violence undermines any chance of reaching a lasting compromise.

title: After Ukraine's incursion into Kursk, Kyiv assumes role of occupying army
summary: For the first time since the beginning of the invasion, Ukraine has taken up the position of 'occupier' in this Russian region. The army knows it must remain above reproach if it is not to jeopardize the country's European integration and the support of its allies.

title: French paleontologists discover new herbivorous dinosaur
summary: Excavations carried out this summer in southwestern France unearthed the remains of a new species of sauropod, a giant herbivore that lived in the region 140 million years ago.

title: Archives reveal the Church considered isolating Abbé Pierre as early as the 1940s
summary: Letters from the Church's national archives reveal that the institution gradually became aware of the 'seriousness' of the acts the famous priest was accused of.

title: Israel strikes Gaza, Lebanon and renews warnings to Iran
summary: Strikes continued in Gaza and Beirut on Sunday as Israel warned Iran from 'taking action.' Tehran announced a mass cancellation of flights from tonight.

title: Macron tells Netanyahu France committed to Israel's security
summary: On the eve of the first anniversary of the October 7 Hamas attack on Israel, French President Emmanuel Macron spoke to the Israeli prime minister by telephone, expressing the 'solidarity' of France with Israel while insisting on a ceasefire.

title: Europe's obsession with immigration
summary: While irregular arrivals have fallen by 39% since the start of 2024, European leaders on both the right and left are not hesitating to borrow ideas that the far right has been advocating for 40 years.

title: One year after October 7, festival survivors are healing through action
summary: Of the 1,195 victims of the terrorist attack perpetrated by Hamas in Israel on October 7, 2023, 364 were participants in the Tribe of Nova festival. These survivors have since formed a close-knit community.

title: Tunisia's presidential election sees low turnout
summary: At the time polling stations closed on Sunday, 2.7 million voters − 27.7% of the electorate − had cast ballots. That's far fewer than the 49% who participated in the first round of the last presidential race in 2019.

title: Wimereux, the new departure point for people attempting to cross the Channel
summary: In the south of Calais, a small French town is increasingly used as a departure point for would-be asylum seekers determined to reach England.
